p: Over the past 50 years, however, the trust in activism has been undermined by various circumstances, most conspicuously in the Euro‐American ‘West’ or ‘North’ where it emerged. The postmodern deposition of the master narrative reflected the observation that power structures had proven more resilient than anticipated: the Euro‐American victories in terms of social welfare, democracy and human rights generally did not extend to the low‐wage nations to which capital increasingly migrated. Moreover, several central concerns of social movements pertained to issues – such as global justice and sustainability – that appeared to transcend the reach of political decision‐making. It became evident that problems of economic polarisation and ecological degradation were intrinsic to the logic of globalised capital.
